ACT
39
The duty of a witness to an oral will
Witnesses in front of whom the testator expressed his last will orally are obliged to write down the content of the testator's statement without delay and hand it over to the court or notary public for safekeeping as soon as possible, or repeat it orally in front of the court or notary public stating when, where and in which on occasions the testator expressed his last will.
Failure to fulfill the duty of a witness from paragraph 1 of this article does not harm the validity of an oral will.
